title: Epic: Agent CLI Integration (Codex CLI / Claude Code / Copilot CLI)
description:
Make ackchyually work reliably with agent CLIs (Codex CLI, Claude Code, Copilot CLI) without users manually editing PATH/rc files.

## Objective
When these agent CLIs execute tools like git/bd/gh via PATH, they should transparently hit ackchyually shims, preserving PTY correctness and producing complete logs/suggestions.

## Success Criteria
- [ ] New command: ackchyually integrate (codex/claude/copilot/all) + status + verify + undo.
- [ ] Codex CLI integration: writes/updates Codex config so spawned commands use shim-first PATH.
- [ ] Claude Code integration: writes/updates ~/.claude/settings.json env so tools use shim-first PATH.
- [ ] Copilot CLI integration: installs a safe wrapper so tools use shim-first PATH.
- [ ] Proactive hint: if codex/claude/copilot are installed but not integrated (or stale), show a clear tip in TTY (rate-limited) and in shim doctor.
- [ ] CI runs auth-free checks where possible (at minimum: config mutation tests; Codex sandbox test if feasible).
- [ ] README + website lead with this use case, including a supported-versions section.

## Out of Scope
- gh copilot (GitHub CLI extension)
- IDE integrations beyond the CLIs above
- Any requirement to authenticate in CI for LLM calls

## Assumptions
- Installing CLIs via npm is feasible in CI (codex: @openai/codex, claude: @anthropic-ai/claude-code, copilot: @github/copilot).
- Full end-to-end agent runs for Claude/Copilot likely require auth; we provide local-only verification scripts if CI cannot do it.

title: Impl: Scan Codex/Copilot logs to diagnose shim usage
description:
Add an auth-free diagnostic helper that scans local agent CLI logs to answer: "Is the agent using the shim path or bypassing it?".

Scope:
- Codex: scan `~/.codex/history.jsonl` and recent `~/.codex/sessions/**.jsonl` for evidence of tool execution paths (e.g., `/usr/bin/git` vs `~/.local/share/ackchyually/shims/git`).
- Copilot: scan `~/.copilot/logs/` (and any documented state/log locations) for evidence of tool execution paths.

Design requirements:
- Safe by default: do NOT print raw log lines; only counts + filenames + high-level findings.
- Bounded: limit bytes scanned per file and number of files scanned (configurable flags).
- Robust: handle missing dirs, huge files, malformed JSONL, and non-UTF8.

UX:
- Add `ackchyually integrate status --scan-logs` (or `ackchyually integrate diagnose`) to surface the results.
- Output should explicitly say if it found references to shim paths, non-shim absolute paths, or neither.

Acceptance Criteria:
- [ ] On a machine with Codex logs, the scan reports whether `git` was invoked via shim path or via `/usr/bin/git`.
- [ ] Unit tests cover parsing/safety/bounds with fixtures.

## Files
- internal/integrations/agentclis/logscan/logscan.go (create: log scanning + summarization)

notes:
Found via helpcount:
- go test unknown flag (-cunt=1) prints usage to STDOUT with 'flag provided but not defined' + 'Usage of ...' so isUsageish missed it.

Fixes:
- isUsageish now checks stdout+stderr+combined and includes Go flag patterns.
- suggest/auto-exec pick best known-good via token overlap + prefix score.
- invocations.created_at stored as RFC3339Nano; candidates parse time robustly.

- isUsageish now includes 'requires a value/argument', 'unknown command/subcommand', and 'for usage'.
